description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府的全国最高民意咨询议政机关，包括了中国国民党、中国共产党及其他抗日党派和无党派人士代表。
description.en: The highest national public opinion advisory and deliberation body of the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China, which included representatives from the Kuomintang, the Communist Party of China, other anti-Japanese parties, and non-partisan individuals.

description.zh-cn: 国防最高会议的咨询机关，是国民参政会的前身。
description.en: The advisory body of the Supreme National Defense Council, and the predecessor of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国抗日战争时期的最高决策机关。
description.en: The supreme decision-making body during the Second Sino-Japanese War in China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的最高政权机关，后继承了国民参政会的职能。
description.en: The highest organ of state power in the Republic of China, which later succeeded the functions of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 国民参政会内设机构，负责推动宪政实施。
description.en: An internal body of the People's Political Council responsible for promoting the implementation of constitutional government.

en: Nationalist government of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 1925年至1948年间中华民国的国家领导机构。
description.en: The state leading body of the Republic of China from 1925 to 1948.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的创建政党，在国民参政会成立及运作中起主导作用。
description.en: The founding party of the Republic of China, which played a leading role in the establishment and operation of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国的执政党，在抗战时期派出代表参加国民参政会。
description.en: The ruling party of China, which sent representatives to participate in the People's Political Council during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，时任国防最高会议主席。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader, who was the chairman of the Supreme National Defense Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治人物，曾任国防最高会议副主席及国民参政会议长。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as the vice chairman of the Supreme National Defense Council and the speaker of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党主要领导人，曾被任命为国防参议会及国民参政会参政员。
description.en: A main leader of the Communist Party of China, who was appointed as a member of the National Defense Council and the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党主要领导人之一，曾代表毛泽东参加国防参议会会议。
description.en: One of the main leaders of the Communist Party of China, who attended meetings of the National Defense Council on behalf of Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 中国教育家，曾任国民参政会代理副议长。
description.en: A Chinese educator who served as the acting deputy speaker of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党创始人之一，国民参政会中共参政员及驻会委员。
description.en: One of the founders of the Communist Party of China, a CCP member and resident committee member of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党及国家领导人之一，国民参政会中共参政员。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Communist Party of China and the state, and a CCP member of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 1938年由中国国民党临时全国代表大会通过的纲领性文件，规定组织国民参政机关。
description.en: A programmatic document passed by the Kuomintang's Provisional National Congress in 1938, which stipulated the organization of a national political participation body.

description.zh-cn: 规定国民参政会组织及职权的法规。
description.en: Regulations defining the organization and powers of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 国共两党于1941年发生的军事冲突，导致中共参政员一度拒绝出席国民参政会会议。
description.en: A military conflict between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China in 1941, which led to CCP members temporarily boycotting the meetings of the People's Political Council.

zh-cn: 中国共产党第七次全国代表大会
en: 7th National Congress of the Communist Party of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的一次重要会议，会后中共声明不参加第四届国民参政会。
description.en: An important meeting of the Communist Party of China, after which the CCP announced its non-participation in the fourth session of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 1945年7月，褚辅成、黄炎培等六名国民参政员访问延安，与中共领导人商谈国事。
description.en: In July 1945, six members of the People's Political Council, including Chu Fucheng and Huang Yanpei, visited Yan'an to discuss state affairs with leaders of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国教育家、政治家，曾任国防参议会参议员、国民参政会参政员，参与了“六参政员访问延安”事件。
description.en: A Chinese educator and politician who served as a member of the National Defense Council and the People's Political Council, and participated in the event 'Six Councillors' Visit to Yan'an'.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治活动家，国民参政会驻会委员，是“六参政员访问延安”的发起人之一。
description.en: A Chinese political activist, resident committee member of the People's Political Council, and one of the initiators of the 'Six Councillors' Visit to Yan'an'.

nodes.id: 请政府定期召集国民大会实行宪政决议案

zh-cn: 请政府定期召集国民大会实行宪政决议案

description.zh-cn: 1939年国民参政会通过的决议案，揭开了抗日战争时期宪政运动的帷幕。
description.en: A resolution passed by the People's Political Council in 1939, which unveiled the constitutional movement during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

nodes.id: 抗日战争时期宪政运动

zh-cn: 抗日战争时期宪政运动

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期在中国各地展开的要求实行宪政的政治运动。
description.en: A political movement demanding the implementation of constitutional government that took place across China during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 由国民参政会宪政期成会通过的宪法草案。
description.en: A draft constitution passed by the Constitutionalism Promotion Committee of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史学家、教育家，曾任国防参议会参议员及国民参政会参政员。
description.en: A Chinese historian and educator who served as a member of the National Defense Council and the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国青年党领导人之一，曾任国防参议会参议员、国民参政会驻会委员及国民政府农林部长。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Chinese Youth Party, who served as a member of the National Defense Council, a resident committee member of the People's Political Council, and the Minister of Agriculture and Forestry of the Nationalist Government.

description.zh-cn: 中国国家社会党领袖，曾任国防参议会参议员及国民参政会驻会委员。
description.en: Leader of the China National Socialist Party, who served as a member of the National Defense Council and a resident committee member of the People's Political Council.

location.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国陕西省

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期中国共产党的军事和政治中心。
description.en: The military and political center of the Communist Party of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 国防参议会是国防最高会议下设的咨询机关。
description.en: The National Defense Council was an advisory body established under the Supreme National Defense Council.

description.zh-cn: 国民参政会于1938年7月成立，同时结束了其前身国防参议会。
description.en: The People's Political Council was established in July 1938, concurrently ending its predecessor, the National Defense Council.

description.zh-cn: 国民大会召开后，国民参政会于1948年3月正式结束。
description.en: After the convening of the National Assembly, the People's Political Council was formally dissolved in March 1948.

description.zh-cn: 宪政期成会是国民参政会内设的机构。
description.en: The Constitutionalism Promotion Committee was an internal body of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在1938年3月向国民党临时全国代表大会提议“健全民意机关”，促成了国民参政会的建立。
description.en: In March 1938, the Communist Party of China proposed to 'strengthen the organs of public opinion' at the Kuomintang's Provisional National Congress, which led to the establishment of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党在临时全国代表大会上决定接受中共提议，并通过《抗战建国纲领》，决定组织国民参政机关。
description.en: The Kuomintang decided to accept the CCP's proposal at its Provisional National Congress and passed the 'Program of Armed Resistance and National Reconstruction,' deciding to organize a national political participation body.

description.zh-cn: 该纲领规定“组织国民参政机关”，为国民参政会的成立提供了法律依据。
description.en: This program stipulated the 'organization of a national political participation body,' providing the legal basis for the establishment of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 1938年6月，国民政府任命汪兆铭（汪精卫）为国民参政会议长。
description.en: In June 1938, the Nationalist Government appointed Wang Zhaoming (Wang Jingwei) as the speaker of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 1938年6月，国民政府任命张伯苓为国民参政会代理副议长。
description.en: In June 1938, the Nationalist Government appointed Zhang Boling as the acting deputy speaker of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东被任命为国民参政会参政员，后于1947年7月31日被国民政府除名。
description.en: Mao Zedong was appointed as a councilor of the People's Political Council and was later removed from the list by the Nationalist Government on July 31, 1947.

description.zh-cn: 董必武是国民参政会中共参政员，并担任第一、二、三、四届驻会委员，后于1947年7月31日被国民政府除名。
description.en: Dong Biwu was a CCP councilor of the People's Political Council, served as a resident committee member for the first four sessions, and was later removed from the list by the Nationalist Government on July 31, 1947.

description.zh-cn: 邓颖超被任命为国民参政会参政员，后于1947年7月31日被国民政府除名。
description.en: Deng Yingchao was appointed as a councilor of the People's Political Council and was later removed from the list by the Nationalist Government on July 31, 1947.

description.zh-cn: 皖南事变后，中国共产党参政员为抗议国民党的反共政策，曾有几次拒绝出席参政会会议，影响了参政会的正常运作。
description.en: After the New Fourth Army Incident, the CCP councilors, in protest of the Kuomintang's anti-communist policies, refused to attend the council's meetings on several occasions, affecting its normal operation.

description.zh-cn: 1945年5月中共七大召开后，中国共产党声明不参加第四届国民参政会。
description.en: After the 7th National Congress of the CCP was held in May 1945, the Communist Party of China declared that it would not participate in the fourth session of the People's Political Council.

description.zh-cn: 国民政府于1947年7月31日发布公报，将中共毛泽东等七人从国民参政会参政员中除名。
description.en: On July 31, 1947, the Nationalist Government issued a gazette removing seven CCP members, including Mao Zedong, from their positions as councilors of the People's Political Council.

relationships.source: 请政府定期召集国民大会实行宪政决议案
relationships.target: 抗日战争时期宪政运动

description.zh-cn: 该决议案的通过揭开了抗日战争时期“晴天霹雳的宪政运动”的帷幕。
description.en: The passing of this resolution unveiled the 'thunderbolt' constitutional movement during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 宪政期成会通过了宪法草案，即《期成宪草》。
description.en: The Constitutionalism Promotion Committee passed the draft constitution known as the 'Qicheng Xiancao'.

description.zh-cn: 黄炎培与其他五位参政员于1945年6月2日致电毛泽东和周恩来，希望继续商谈，促成了此次访问。
description.en: On June 2, 1945, Huang Yanpei and five other councilors sent a telegram to Mao Zedong and Zhou Enlai, hoping to continue negotiations, which led to this visit.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东与周恩来复电欢迎六位参政员访问延安，并亲自到机场迎接。
description.en: Mao Zedong and Zhou Enlai replied with a telegram welcoming the six councilors to visit Yan'an and personally greeted them at the airport.

description.zh-cn: 在访问延安期间，黄炎培在杨家岭的窑洞里与毛泽东会面，并进行了关于“历史周期率”的著名对话，即“窑洞对”。
description.en: During his visit to Yan'an, Huang Yanpei met with Mao Zedong in a cave dwelling in Yangjialing and had the famous conversation about the 'historical cycle', known as the 'cave-dwelling dialogue'.
